title: How to EASILY Find Hidden Profitable Niches on Amazon KDP...without any software

tactics.name: narrow-niche-research
tactics.description: Identify profitable niches by drilling down from broad genres to specific subniches and target audiences.
caveats: Avoid overly broad niches with low demand
source_quotes: If you don't do the right niche, it's kind of like you have a house and you're just building it on quicksand.

tactics.name: narrow-niche-validation
tactics.description: Identify niche, subniche, and target audience through iterative narrowing
example_niches: how to draw animals for kids
source_quotes: We can do this for men, for women, for old people, for seniors.

tactics.name: Validate Niche with Page 1 Competitors
tactics.description: Focus on books ranked 1-2 in search results that are actively selling, not irrelevant or non-selling books on later pages.
steps: Check sales numbers and review counts
Identify relevant competitors in the same subniche
caveats: If only 1-2 books are selling, competition may be higher
source_quotes: Most of the books are on page two and beyond... only the books on page one are actually considered your competitors.

tactics.name: sales_range_analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate niche viability by analyzing sales ranges of existing books
steps: Check search results for niche keywords
Assess competition levels and sales potential
caveats: Irrelevant search results on deeper pages
example_niches: how to draw animal for kids
source_quotes: If I publish my book and it's good enough to compete... I know that I can probably make a sale at least a minimum one sale a day

heuristics.name: demand-validation
heuristics.condition: If a niche lacks sufficient review volume or BSR ranking, it may not be profitable
source_quotes: We want a niche that can give us money.

heuristics.name: ignore-search-volume
heuristics.condition: If search result counts are cited, disregard their relevance
source_quotes: This does not mean I have 15,000 competitors.

heuristics.name: Sales Diversity Signal
heuristics.condition: If multiple books in the niche have varying sales volumes, it indicates market opportunity
source_quotes: This guy might be selling seven copies a day... this guy might be selling 101 copies a day.

heuristics.name: sales_variation_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If niche shows sales variation (1-100/day) then boost
source_quotes: We have books selling one copy a day all the way up to 100 copies a day

claims.statement: Profitability on Amazon KDP depends on niche demand, not just book quality
source_quotes: It doesn't matter how good your book is... if you found a niche and you're publishing in a niche that can't be profitable...

claims.statement: Amazon KDP validation focuses on review counts and BSR rather than search volume
source_quotes: Who cares how many search results is in your niche.

claims.statement: Search result volume is irrelevant for competition analysis
source_quotes: This does not mean... it doesn't work. Nothing like that.

claims.statement: Niche with no sales data indicates no market demand
source_quotes: If you go in the niche and you can't find any books that are selling... there is no market for that book

niche_patterns.description: Combine broad genre with specific subniche and target audience for targeted profitability
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Limits competition while maintaining enough search volume for sales
source_quotes: We need to figure out who our target audience is.

niche_patterns.example: divorced men + dating challenges + low confidence
niche_patterns.description: Combine audience identity with specific problems and limitations
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates hyper-targeted niches with unmet needs
source_quotes: We're only doing a dating book. We're not doing a grieving book.
